expr

Class ExprParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • expr.ExprParser

  • public class ExprParser
extends Object
    An ExprParser object is a parser provides a factory method for building Expr objects from text representations of arithmetic expressions. The text containing the expression should adhere to the following grammar. 
     
 
 
    expr ::= term {addop term}
    term ::= factor {mulop factor}
    factor ::= number | variable | "(" expr ")"
    addop ::= "+" | "-"
    mulop ::= "*" | "/"
    where number is an unsigned number according to StreamTokenizer and variable is a string of letters and digits. The first character must be a letter.
    Author:
    Lennart Andersson
    See Also:
    Expr, StreamTokenizer

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public Expr build(Reader reader)
           throws IOException
        The build method returns an Expr representation of the expression provided by reader.
        Parameters:
        reader - a Reader provided the string to be parsed.
        Returns:
        an Expr representation of the string.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the reader does not deliver data.
        ExprParserException - if the reader input violates the grammar.

      • build

        public Expr build(String input)
           throws IOException
        The build method returns an Expr representation of the expression provided by the input string.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to be parsed.
        Returns:
        an Expr representation of the string.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the input does not deliver data.
        XLException - if the input violates the grammar.
